Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 1

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 1

Welcome to the intermediate vocabulary section! These words will help you express more complex ideas and enhance your English communication skills.

Navigation

This is page 1 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Acquire

/əˈkwaɪər/

verb

To come into possession or ownership of something.

"She acquired a taste for coffee after living in Italy."

Synonyms: obtain, gain, procure

Category: General

Accomplish

/əˈkʌmplɪʃ/

verb

To complete or achieve something successfully.

"He accomplished his goal of running a marathon."

Synonyms: achieve, complete, fulfill

Category: Achievement

Adequate

/ˈædɪkwət/

adjective

Satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity.

"The salary was adequate for their basic needs."

Synonyms: sufficient, satisfactory, acceptable

Category: Quality

Anticipate

/ænˈtɪsəpeɪt/

verb

To expect or look forward to something.

"We anticipate heavy traffic during rush hour."

Synonyms: expect, foresee, predict

Category: Thinking

Approximately

/əˈprɑːksəmətli/

adverb

Used to show that something is almost, but not completely, accurate or exact.

"The building is approximately 100 meters tall."

Synonyms: roughly, about, around

Category: Measurement

Attitude

/ˈætɪtuːd/

noun

A settled way of thinking or feeling about someone or something.

"She has a positive attitude toward learning new languages."

Synonyms: mindset, outlook, perspective

Category: Psychology

Beneficial

/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃəl/

adjective

Favorable or advantageous; resulting in good.

"Regular exercise is beneficial for your health."

Synonyms: advantageous, helpful, useful

Category: Quality

Capacity

/kəˈpæsəti/

noun

The maximum amount that something can contain or produce.

"The stadium has a capacity of 50,000 people."

Synonyms: volume, capability, ability

Category: Measurement

Circumstance

/ˈsɜːrkəmstæns/

noun

A fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action.

"Under normal circumstances, the meeting would be held in person."

Synonyms: situation, condition, context

Category: Situation

Colleague

/ˈkɑːliːɡ/

noun

A person with whom one works in a profession or business.

"She discussed the project with her colleagues."

Synonyms: coworker, associate, partner

Category: Work

Compromise

/ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/

noun, verb

An agreement reached by mutual concession; to settle a dispute by mutual concession.

"They reached a compromise after hours of negotiation."

Synonyms: settlement, agreement, deal

Category: Business

Concentrate

/ˈkɑːnsəntreɪt/

verb

To focus one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.

"I need to concentrate on my studies for the exam."

Synonyms: focus, center, direct

Category: Thinking

Page 1 of 15
